character_schedule.afternoon: 在办公室里批改一叠论文，被学生的“不学无术”给逗笑了。
character_schedule.night:
去威士忌吧小酌，有颜值女网红来搭讪借酒拍视频，拒绝，被网红吐槽有钱却很小气。酒吧扭扭舞会时间到，主持人热烈邀请他，他又拒绝，听到服务人员小声讨论自己是很高冷的顾客。但自己并不这么认为，想着，某天如果遇到想一起跳扭扭舞的人，会毫不犹豫地参与的。
可作讨论点的部分，扭扭舞、拒绝是否等于小气、高冷的性格等等

relationship: Two people have just met and are still unfamiliar with each other. Their conversations are mostly polite and superficial, limited to everyday topics like work, studies, or the weather. At this stage, both sides are cautious and have yet to reveal their true selves.

dialogue.content: 你好
你好啊同学
［小人跳舞］
学啥的？最近在关注什么东西？
最近。。。。还在读文章吧，刚加入个实验室。
我们是做加速器的
加速器？
是车？粒子加速器？还是？
哦哦那不至于，是做算法加速的
类似于gpu
But gpus suck ass so
啊？现在gpu市值很高啊？
为什么很差？讲来我听听？
没有很多要说，就是觉得gpu有点德不配位
一些我个人的偏见而已
可能源自于自己对gpu架构理解不深
没什么好说的
gpt的评价是干matrix mul够用，但是communication protocol 很死板，必须要copy memory什么的
你觉得什么东西配位呢？
啥新颖点
for example the definition of cuda core
it's just a functional unit
it's not a core
so in cpu core, there's fancy prefetching, load/store queue, cache
That's a CORE
GPU is just an accelerator, good at parallel workloads, and that's it
BTW AI is just a parallel workload, as any other workload, nothing special

Hmmm it sounds like to me like the memory prefetching, cache all deals with some sort of abstractions that shortens the need for grabbing memory from disk vs ram and serves to save space/time for instructions and memroy access

But intuitively to me the ai workloads must at all times be aware of all of the memory at hand, so if it doesnt have the capabilitiies to directly manage the host memory it must retain all of the memory until the workload is done
Like cache for example works because something can be accessed in a short time after
Hmmm interesting, doesn't triton utilize kv-cacheing? Is that not done on the GPU side via cuda?
I don't think GPU memory is included as a uniform memory space seen by host side
btw kv-caching is not real cache in HW, it's just a term used by AI people
kv-cache is in memory imo
and I know nothing about triton
so you may not want to ask me about that
Lmao
So its still copying things to and from device
Wild
Yeah i get what youre saying now
right
That is a pretty stupid architecture
[捂脸]
Well, I heard software may enable this, but hardware I don't think so
Nice
